Specifics (Fire Department High School). Education. Reference.

Includes several files concerning FDNY initiatives to develop new forms of training for firefighters (distance learning/web-based, CDs, partnerships with NYU or other colleges, vendor software for computer-based training from ATR Inc and others, and the like). Also includes extensive material on "FDHS" (a/k/a Homeland Security High School), a high school setting in Fort Totten, targeted at Thomas Jefferson High School students from East New York, with rich planning and execution documentation (2003-06) (idea is to create apprentice firefighters, as part of a larger goal of increasing diversity in recruitment and ranks). Copy of Columbia University's report "Improving Workforce Diversity in the FDNY", 2004, with two earlier draft reports (2003); research done by School of International and Public Affairs for FDNY. Several Spadafora business cards. CDs of "Battalion Chiefs Digital Imaging and Presentation Training" and DVD "Powerpoint Presentation: Critique Notes/Digital Photos" both from 2005. Copies of Powerpoint slides and other material on "Personal Safety System." (Includes digital formats)
